ruleId.description: ID of the rule for which content is required.
ruleId.name: ruleId

clusterId.description: ID of the cluster in valid UUID format

cluster_name.description: An human-readable name for the cluster

hits_by_total_risk.description: Dictionary with numeric representation of total risk as keys, the number of rule hits by each total risk as values.

last_checked_at.description: [Optional] Last time of analysis for given cluster.

total_hit_count.description: Total number of rules hitting for given cluster. 0 combined with an empty last_checked_at means we haven't received any archive from that cluster. 0 hits with a valid timestamp means we have an archive, but there are no rule hits.

clusterListResponse.description: Response data type for GET /clusters endpoint

highest_severity.description: Highest recommendation severity affecting this namespace + cluster

hits_by_severity.description: A dictionary with the number of DVO recommendation hits grouped by their severity. Always provides the severity keys even if there are no recommendations currently hitting.

objects.description: Total number of unique objects (workloads) being affected by DVO recommendations in this namespace. When a workload is being affected by several recommendations at once, it still counts as one affected object/workload in the context of a namespace.

recommendations.description: Total number of DVO recommendations affecting this namespace

gatheringRequests.description: List of stored requests for given orgId + clusterId

namespaceId.description: ID of the namespace in a valid UUID format

example.description: Introducing Insights for Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform

description.description: The title of the rule, a short description.

disabled.description: Whether the rule has been disabled/acked for all clusters or not.

generic.description: More specific, cluster-independent description of the rule

impact.description: How much of an impact this rule has on a cluster.

impacted_clusters_count.description: The number of clusters impacted by this rule. Disabled clusters are excluded from the count. If the rule is acked, it is just marked as disabled:true and the count is still returned.

likelihood.description: How likely is this rule to hit.

publish_date.description: The date the rule was published. 'Added at' field in UI

resolution_risk.description: Indicates the impact of the resolution steps on the cluster and other associated risks. Behaves in the same way as total_risk, 0 is returned when the rule doesn't have a resolution_risk defined.

rule_id.description: The rule ID in the | format.

tags.description: List of tags that the rule contains

total_risk.description: Total risk - calculated from rule impact and likelihood.

recommendationListResponse.description: Response data type for GET /rule endpoint

reportData.description: /clusters/{clusterId}/report returns an array of ruleHit instances

example.description: Introducing Insights for Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform
example.details:
Red Hat Insights for OpenShift is a proactive management solution. It provides ongoing infrastructure analyses of your Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 4.2 and later installations. Red Hat Insights helps you identify, prioritize, and resolve risks to security, performance, availability, and stability before they become urgent issues.
Red Hat Insights for OpenShift uses the Remote Health Monitoring feature of OpenShift 4. The health checks are created by Red Hat subject matter experts and assessed according to severity and impact.
This is an example  recommendation that you can safely ignore. To disable it, click  the triple-dot menu button next to the header, and select Disable.

[Knowledgebase Article](https://access.redhat.com/search/#/knowledgebase)

description.description: The title of the rule, a short description.

details.description: Details of the rule - templates rendered on frontend.

disabled.description: If this rule result disabled or not. This field can be used in the UI to show only specific set of rules results.

extra_data.description: Used as templating data for other content (details, resolution, etc.), has varying structure depending on the rules in the report.

impacted.description: [Optional] Timestamp when the rule first started hitting

reason.description: Reason for the issue, giving the user more accurate description of the cause.

resolution.description: Resolution steps of the issue, possibly linking to a resolution article in the knowledge base.

tags.description: List of tags that the rule contains, forming rule groups.

total_risk.description: Total risk - calculated from rule impact and likelihood.

user_vote.description: User vote - value of user voting. -1 is dislike vote, 0 is no vote, 1 is like vote.

cluster_name.description: The display name of the cluster

managed.description: Flag indicating if the cluster is managed or not

reportResponse.description: Response data type for GET /clusters/{clusterId}/report endpoint

statusResponse.description: response status for the processed request

systemWideRuleDisable.description: An information about rule that has been disabled for whole account

created_at.description: Timestamp when the rule has been acked/disabled

rule.description: Rule selector: rule ID + error key

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the rule justification has been changed (can be empty)

systemWideRuleDisableList.description: List of all system-wide disabled rules

info.description: Aggregation service for the results of running Insights rules.
info.title: Insights Results Aggregator

get.description: Lists acks from this account where the rule is active. Will return empty list if this account has no acks

200.description: List of acked rules

get.summary: Lists acks from this account where the rule is active

post.description: Acknowledges (and therefore hides) a rule from view in an account. If there's already an acknowledgement of this rule by this account, then return that. Othervise, a new ack is created.

requestBody.description: Specification of rule selector (ID+error key) and a justification why rule has been disabled.

200.description: Rule has been disabled already

post.summary: Acknowledges/hide the rule for given account

delete.description: Deletes an acknowledgement for a rule, by its rule ID. If the ack existed, it is deleted and a 204 is returned. Otherwise, a 404 is returned.

parameters.description: Specification of rule selector (ID+error key) and a justification why rule has been disabled.
parameters.name: rule_id

404.description: Rule has not been acked (disabled) previously

delete.summary: Deletes an acknowledgement for a rule

get.description: AckGetEndpoint read the acknowledgement info about disabled rule

parameters.description: Specification of rule selector (ID+error key) and a justification why rule has been disabled.
parameters.name: rule_id

200.description: Rule ack has been found, the metadata is returned in response body

404.description: Rule has not been acked (disabled) previously

get.summary: AckGetEndpoint read the acknowledgement info about disabled rule

put.description: Updates an acknowledgement for a rule, by rule ID. A new justification can be supplied.

requestBody.description: Specification of justification why rule has been disabled.

200.description: Rule ack has been found and updated, the metadata is returned in response body

404.description: Rule has not been acked (disabled) previously

put.summary: Updates an acknowledgement for a rule, by rule ID.

get.description: Cluster ID is given in URL. Organization ID in token must match the one under which the cluster is registered in AMS.

schema.description: Response data type for GET /clusters/{clusterId}/info endpoint

display_name.description: An human-readable name for the cluster

managed.description: Indicates whether cluster is managed or not (has 'managed' flag in AMS)

status.description: Status of the cluster, such as Active, Deprovisioned, etc

200.description: Information about the given cluster retrieved from AMS API.

400.description: Invalid request, usually caused when some cluster belongs to different organization.

404.description: Cluster info was not returned from AMS API for given organization.

get.summary: Returns relevant information about the cluster available in AMS API.

get.description: Report that is going to be returned is specified by its cluster IDs that is part of path.

parameters.description: If true, disabled rules will be sent too.
parameters.name: get_disabled

200.description: Latest available report for the given organization and cluster combination. Returns rules and their descriptions that were hit by the cluster. Disabled rules are omitted by default unless the get_disabled query param is provided.

400.description: Invalid request, usually caused when some cluster belongs to different organization.

404.description: Cluster report is not available, probably not connected cluster.

get.summary: Returns the latest report for the given cluster.

get.description:
For the given cluster and request IDs, return the simplified report, if any. Response should have the following format:
```
{
"cluster": "{clusterID}",
"requestID": "{requestID}",
"status": "{string}",
"report": "{simplifiedReportStructure}",
}```
Where simplifiedReportStructure might look like:
```[
"rule_fqdn": "",
"error_key": "",
"description": "",
"total_risk": "",
]
```

200.description: Simplified report for given cluster and request IDs

400.description: Invalid request or invalid cluster ID

404.description: Cluster or request ID not found

get.summary: Retrieve simplified reports for a given cluster and request IDs if available

get.description:
The status of the request with given ID if found. The cluster ID is required so only requests for the given cluster are returned, if any. Response should have the following format: ```
{
"cluster": "{clusterID}",
"requestID":"{requestID}",
"status": "{string}"
}
```

200.description: Stored status for the given cluster and request IDs

400.description: Invalid request or invalid cluster ID

404.description: Request ID or cluster ID not found

get.summary: Check status of a given cluster's request

get.description:
Provides a list of all the recorded requests for the cluster with given ID, if any. Response should have following format:
```{
"cluster":"{clusterID}",
"requests":[{array}],
"status":"{string}"
}
```
Where {array} contains following objects:
```{
"requestID": {requestID},
"valid: True,
"received": {timestamp},
"processed": {timestamp},
}
```

200.description: List of requests available (last 24 hours) for the given organization and cluster and their status.

400.description: Invalid request (e.g cluster ID with unexpected format)

get.summary: List of requests for given cluster

post.description:
A list of requests for given cluster, filtered by the provided request IDs, if any. List of request IDs should be in format
```[
"requestID1",
"requestID2",
 ...,"requestID3"
]
```
Response is in format:
```{
"cluster": "{clusterID}"
"requests": [{array}]
"status": "{string}"
}
```
Where {array} contains the following objects:
```{
"requestID": {requestID},
"valid": true/false depends if this is valid/known request ID,
"received": {timestamp},
"processed": {timestamp},
}
```

200.description: List of requests available (last 24 hours) for the given organization and cluster and their status.

400.description: Invalid request (e.g cluster ID with unexpected format) or payload (empty body or not a list of strings)

404.description: Cluster ID not found or no requests found in storage for provided IDs

post.summary: Filtered list of stored requests for given cluster ID

get.description: Get a prediction of whether a cluster upgrade would fail.

last_checked_at.description: [Optional] Last time of analysis for given cluster.

200.description: Status ok

204.description: Status NoContent: happens when the cluster is managed. The upgrade risks prediction is not available for this kind of clusters.

404.description: Status NotFound: happens when the cluster cannot be found in the Observatorium data

503.description: Status NotAvailable: happens when the AMS API or the Upgrade Risks Prediction service is not available.

get.description: Retrieves all clusters for given organization, retrieves the impacting rules for each cluster and calculates the count of impacting rules by total risk (severity == critical, high, moderate, low)

200.description: If a cluster has 0 total_hit_count and empty last_checked_at timestamp, we have no Insights data for that archive. If total_hit_count = 0 and the timestamp is valid, there are no rule hits for the cluster.

503.description: A dependent service such as AMS API or results aggregator is unavailable. Specified in status message.

get.summary: Returns a list of clusters, total number of hitting rules and a count of impacting rules by total risk.

get.description: The static content is taken from the cache periodically updated from the content service

200.description: A JSON object with the content.

get.description: This simply redirects to an endpoint of the same name of a service called insights-content-service

200.description: A JSON array of groups.

get.summary: Get all rule groups and their relevant information

get.description: InfoEndpoint returns basic information about Smart Proxy, Insights Results Aggregator, and Content Service version, utils repository version, commit hash etc.

200.description: An object containing information about Smart Proxy, Insights Results Aggregator, and Content Service.

get.summary: Returns basic information about Smart Proxy, Insights Results Aggregator, and Content Service.

get.description: Set of metrics provided by insights-operator-utils library providing total number of requests counter, API endpoints response times, and counter of HTTP status code responses. Additionally it is possible to consume all metrics provided by Go runtime. These metrics start with go_ and process_ prefixes.

200.description: Default response containing all metrics in semi-structured text format

get.summary: Read all metrics exposed by this service

get.description: For the user's organization, return a list of namespaces and aggregate information about each namespace

workloads.description: A list of namespaces, aggregate data about their workloads and DVO recommendations. Returns an empty list when a cluster is known, but no recommendations were found.

display_name.description: A human-readable name for the cluster

name.description: A human-readable name for the namespace

200.description: Namespaces for DVO workloads

400.description: Invalid request or invalid cluster ID

404.description: Cluster was not found in the AMS API.

get.summary: Retrieve DVO namespaces and recommendation aggregations for the whole organization

get.description: For the given cluster and namespace IDs, return a list of DVO recommendations, complete with the descriptions and steps to resolve.

display_name.description: A human-readable name for the cluster

name.description: A human-readable name for the namespace

check.description: The rule ID in the | format.

details.description: The title of the rule, a short description.

extra_data.description: Used as templating/interpolation data for other content (details, resolution, etc.), has varying structure depending on the rules in the report, but should always be a valid JSON object.

modified.description: The date the recommendation was last updated.

display_name.description: A human-readable name for the cluster

reason.description: Reason for the issue, giving the user more accurate description of the cause.

resolution.description: Resolution steps of the issue, possibly linking to a resolution article in the knowledge base.

total_risk.description: Total risk - calculated from rule impact and likelihood.

200.description: DVO recommendations for namespace + cluster

400.description: Invalid request or invalid cluster ID

404.description: Data for cluster and namespace were not found in the storage.

get.summary: Retrieve DVO recommendations for a single namespace + cluster combination.

get.description: The OpenAPI specification of this REST API service that is represented in formatted and human-readable JSON is available under this endpoint.

200.description: A JSON containing the OpenAPI specification for this service.

post.description: Return the new rating. Any previous rating for this rule by this user is amended to the current value. This does not attempt to delete a rating by this user of thus rule if the rating is zero.

requestBody.description: A JSON object with the current rule and its rating.

200.description: The current rating value for the rule

201.description: The current rating value for the rule

400.description: Invalid request, usually caused when some rule identifier doesn't exist

post.summary: Send the new rating for a given rule

get.description: The affected clusters are based on the requester's organization. If the AMS API is available, the clusters are pulled from there, otherwise we retrieve the clusters from our database.

parameters.description: If param is missing, endpoint will return all available rules including those that don't hit any clusters at the moment. If set to true, only returns impacting rules. If false, only returns those that aren't impacting.
parameters.name: impacting

200.description: Returns a list recommendations and the number of clusters they're currently impacting. Default behaviour is to return only the rules that affect atleast one cluster. This can be changed by passing impacting parameter

get.summary: Returns a list recommendations and the number of clusters they're currently impacting.

get.description: The static content is taken from the cache periodically updated from the content service. The user specific parts need trips to the aggregator service.

description.description: The title of the rule, a short description.

disabled.description: Whether the rule has been disabled/acked for all clusters or not.

generic.description: More specific, cluster-independent description of the rule

impact.description: How much of an impact this rule has on a cluster.

likelihood.description: How likely is this rule to hit.

publish_date.description: The date the rule was published. 'Added at' field in UI

rating.description: User vote - value of user voting. -1 is dislike vote, 0 is no vote, 1 is like vote.

reason.description: Reason for the issue, giving the user more accurate description of the cause.

resolution.description: Resolution steps of the issue, possibly linking to a resolution article in the knowledge base.

resolution_risk.description: Indicates the impact of the resolution steps on the cluster and other associated risks. Behaves in the same way as total_risk, 0 is returned when the rule doesn't have a resolution_risk defined.

tags.description: List of tags that the rule contains

total_risk.description: Total risk - calculated from rule impact and likelihood.

200.description: A JSON object with the content.

generic.description: More specific, cluster-independent description of the rule

impact.description: How much of an impact this rule has on a cluster.

likelihood.description: How likely is this rule to hit.

get.summary: Get all static content for the given ruleId.

get.description: Provided a correct rule selector and a valid organization ID, this method will query the DB for all the organization's clusters being currently affected by the rule, if any.

parameters.description: Recommendation identifier, in the plugin_name|error_key format
parameters.name: rule_selector

disabled.description: A list of clusters for which the user has disabled this rule

cluster_name.description: An human-readable name for the cluster

justification.description: User given justification why rule was disabled.

enabled.description: A list of clusters, which are hitting this rule and are enabled.

cluster_name.description: An human-readable name for the cluster

impacted.description: [Optional] Timestamp of the rule first started hitting

cluster_version.description: Version of OpenShift in the cluster

200.description: List of cluster data for provided rule

400.description: Request body could not be parsed, so the query is not processed

404.description: Resource not found, usually caused when some rule selector, organization or user doesn't exist

500.description: Internal server error, should only be returned if unexpected error happened when querying from the DB

get.summary: Returns a list of cluster where the given rule is active. Also returns a list of clusters, for which the rule has been disabled.

post.description: Predictions that are going to be returned are specified by list of cluster IDs that is part of request body.

requestBody.description: List of cluster IDs. Each ID must conform to UUID format.

200.description: Latest available update prediction for the given list of cluster IDs. Returns status of the prediction and their predictor facts that were taken into account for each cluster.

400.description: Invalid request, usually caused when some cluster belongs to different organization.

post.summary: Returns the prediction based on latest stats for the given list of clusters.
